ground_truth: Pippin finishes his bittersweet song and looks up at Denethor, who continues as if he has not sent his son to his death. Pippin turns away, his sorrow etched on his young face. Gandalf sits quietly in a courtyard, alone and defeated. Great siege towers and catapults roll along the repaired bridge that spans both sides of Osgiliath, heading straight towards Minas Tirith. Aragorn, Théoden, Éomer, Merry, Legolas, and Gimli gallop into a vast camp beneath the cover of trees, teeming with men, horses, and tents. Théoden acknowledges Grimbold, a Marshal of Rohan, as he passes by a group of soldiers and smiles grimly as he rides on. Aragorn joins Théoden on a bluff overlooking the encampment. The camera cranes to reveal thousands of men and horses with smoke from many small campfires filling the valley. Aragorn turns to Théoden, who realizes that no matter the numbers, he must commit to war by the morning and nods. The horses whinny loudly in the distance as Théoden looks up at the mountain looming behind them. Horses rear in terror as Rohan soldiers try to quiet them. Legolas and Gimli move through the camp. Legolas looks at a group of Rohan soldiers who sit quiet and hunched, with no one speaking, and then looks toward Éomer, who is unsaddling his horse. Gimli's eyes travel to a row of ancient standing stones marking the entrance to a road leading away from the encampment and into the mountain. Aragorn stands before the road as though transfixed, before him a horse whinnies and pulls at his ropes nervously, and a ghostly figure seems to emerge from the gloom. Aragorn starts in fright as he stares down at the little dwarf, then casts another look back at the ancient standing stones before following Gimli. All is quiet in the encampment. Éowyn kneels before Merry, adjusting his helmet. Merry exhales, excited and terrified in equal measure. In his excitement, he draws his sword, and Éowyn steps back, laughing. As Éowyn and Merry leave the tent, Éomer and Gamling sit nearby, finishing a meal. Éowyn ushers Merry off, and Merry hurries away. Éomer watches the young hobbit leave as Gamling stifles a laugh. Éowyn turns on both of them. At the plateau edge, a guard looks down the steep precipice as a horse and rider move along the ridge. The hooded figure slowly rides up the narrow zigzag track leading up to the plateau. Aragorn tosses in his sleep, disturbed by images and voices. As Arwen lies dying, the Evenstar falls from her fingers. At that moment, Aragorn wakes, his sword quickly in his hand as a guard stands in the doorway. Aragorn hurries towards Théoden's tent, and Théoden looks up as Aragorn enters.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Pippin concludes his poignant tune and glances up at Denethor, who persists as though he has not dispatched his offspring to his demise. Pippin turns away, his grief engraved on his youthful visage. Gandalf rests quietly in a courtyard, solitary and vanquished. Enormous assault towers and trebuchets roll along the mended span that links both sides of Osgiliath, heading directly towards Minas Tirith. Aragorn, Théoden, Éomer, Merry, Legolas, and Gimli gallop into a broad encampment beneath the shelter of trees, brimming with men, steeds, and tents. Théoden acknowledges Grimbold, a Marshal of Rohan, as he proceeds by a cluster of soldiery and smiles sternly as he rides on. Aragorn joins Théoden on a promontory overlooking the encampment. The camera cranes to disclose thousands of men and steeds with smoke from numerous diminutive campfires filling the vale. Aragorn turns to Théoden, who comprehends that regardless of the numbers, he must pledge to battle by the dawn and nods. The steeds neigh stridently in the remoteness as Théoden looks up at the peak looming behind them. Steeds rear in dread as Rohan soldiery attempt to calm them. Legolas and Gimli maneuver through the encampment. Legolas gazes at a cluster of Rohan soldiery who sit silent and hunched, with no one speaking, and then looks toward Éomer, who is unsaddling his steed. Gimli's eyes travel to a row of ancient standing stones marking the entrance to a route leading away from the encampment and into the peak. Aragorn stands before the route as though mesmerized, before him a steed neighs and pulls at his tethers apprehensively, and a spectral figure seems to emerge from the murk. Aragorn starts in alarm as he stares down at the little dwarf, then casts another glance back at the ancient standing stones before following Gimli. All is silent in the encampment. Éowyn kneels before Merry, adjusting his helm. Merry exhales, thrilled and terrified in equal measure. In his exhilaration, he draws his blade, and Éowyn steps back, laughing. As Éowyn and Merry exit the tent, Éomer and Gamling sit nearby, concluding a repast. Éowyn ushers Merry off, and Merry scurries away. Éomer watches the youthful hobbit depart as Gamling suppresses a laugh. Éowyn turns on both of them. At the ledge edge, a guard gazes down the sheer cliff as a steed and rider move along the ridge. The hooded figure slowly rides up the narrow zigzag track leading up to the ledge. Aragorn tosses in his slumber, disturbed by visions and voices. As Arwen lies dying, the Evenstar falls from her digits. At that moment, Aragorn wakes, his blade swiftly in his grasp as a guard stands in the portal. Aragorn hurries towards Théoden's tent, and Théoden looks up as Aragorn enters.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Pippin's bittersweet song is finished by him, and Denethor is looked up at by him, who continues as if his son has not been sent to his death by him. Pippin's sorrow is etched on his young face as he turns away. A courtyard is sat in quietly by Gandalf, who is alone and defeated. A repaired bridge spanning both sides of Osgiliath is rolled along by great siege towers and catapults, heading straight towards Minas Tirith. A vast camp beneath the cover of trees is galloped into by Aragorn, Théoden, Éomer, Merry, Legolas, and Gimli, teeming with men, horses, and tents. Grimbold, a Marshal of Rohan, is acknowledged by Théoden as a group of soldiers is passed by him, and a grim smile is given by him as he rides on. Théoden is joined by Aragorn on a bluff overlooking the encampment. Thousands of men and horses with smoke from many small campfires filling the valley are revealed by the camera crane. Théoden is turned to by Aragorn, who realizes that no matter the numbers, he must commit to war by the morning, and a nod is given by him. The mountain looming behind them is looked up at by Théoden as loud whinnies of horses are heard in the distance. Rearing horses in terror are quieted by Rohan soldiers. The camp is moved through by Legolas and Gimli. A group of quiet and hunched Rohan soldiers, with no one speaking, is looked at by Legolas, who then looks toward Éomer unsaddling his horse. A row of ancient standing stones marking a road leading away from the encampment and into the mountain is noticed by Gimli's eyes. The road is stood before by Aragorn as though transfixed, a horse whinnies and pulls at his ropes nervously before him, and a ghostly figure emerging from the gloom is seen by him. Aragorn, starting in fright, stares down at the little dwarf, then casts another look back at the ancient standing stones before Gimli is followed by him. The encampment is quiet. Merry's helmet is adjusted by Éowyn as she kneels before him. Excitement and terror in equal measure are exhaled by Merry. In his excitement, his sword is drawn by him, and Éowyn, stepping back, laughs. The tent is exited by Éowyn and Merry, Éomer and Gamling sitting nearby, finishing a meal. Merry is ushered off by Éowyn, and away he hurries. The young hobbit is watched leaving by Éomer as Gamling stifles a laugh. Éowyn turns on both of them. The steep precipice is looked down at by a guard at the plateau edge as a horse and rider move along the ridge. The narrow zigzag track leading up to the plateau is slowly ridden up by the hooded figure. Aragorn tosses in his sleep, disturbed by images and voices. The Evenstar is dropped from Arwen's fingers as she lies dying. At that moment, Aragorn wakes, his sword is quickly in his hand as a guard stands in the doorway. Théoden's tent is hurried towards by Aragorn, and Théoden looks up as he enters.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Pippin finishes his bittersweet song and looks up at Denethor, who remains indifferent about his son's fate. Pippin turns away, sorrow etched on his young face. Gandalf sits alone in a courtyard, defeated. Siege towers and catapults roll across the repaired bridge at Osgiliath, heading towards Minas Tirith. Aragorn, Théoden, Éomer, Merry, Legolas, and Gimli arrive at a vast forest camp filled with men, horses, and tents. Théoden acknowledges Marshal Grimbold, grimly passing soldiers. Aragorn joins Théoden on a bluff, overlooking the camp with its smoke-filled valley. Aragorn turns to Théoden, who realizes he must commit to war by morning and nods. Horses whinny in the distance as Rohan soldiers try to calm them. Legolas and Gimli move through the camp. Legolas notices silent Rohan soldiers and Éomer unsaddling his horse. Gimli observes ancient standing stones marking the road into the mountain. Aragorn stands transfixed before the road, a horse nervously pulling its ropes, as a ghostly figure emerges. Aragorn starts in fright, then follows Gimli. All is quiet in the camp. Éowyn kneels before Merry, adjusting his helmet. Merry, excited and terrified, draws his sword, making Éowyn laugh. As they leave the tent, Éomer and Gamling finish a meal. Éowyn ushers Merry off, and Merry hurries away. Éomer watches the hobbit leave as Gamling stifles a laugh. Éowyn turns on them. At the plateau edge, a guard watches a horse and rider ascend a narrow track. Aragorn tosses in sleep, disturbed by visions. As Arwen lies dying, the Evenstar falls from her fingers. Aragorn wakes, sword in hand, as a guard stands in the doorway. Aragorn hurries to Théoden's tent, where Théoden looks up as Aragorn enters.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Pippin finishes his bittersweet song, looking up at Denethor, who acts unaffected by sending his son to his death. Sorrowful, Pippin turns away. Gandalf sits alone in a courtyard, defeated. Siege towers and catapults move along a repaired bridge towards Minas Tirith. Aragorn, Théoden, Éomer, Merry, Legolas, and Gimli arrive at a camp filled with men, horses, and tents. Théoden greets Marshal Grimbold and grimly rides on. On a bluff, Aragorn and Théoden see thousands in the camp. Théoden nods, accepting war is inevitable by morning. Horses whinny as Théoden looks at the looming mountain. Legolas observes quiet Rohan soldiers and Éomer unsaddling. Gimli sees ancient stones marking a road to the mountain. Aragorn, transfixed by the road, stands before a horse and ghostly figure, then follows Gimli. All is quiet. Éowyn adjusts Merry's helmet, who is excited and terrified. Merry draws his sword; Éowyn laughs. As they leave the tent, Éomer and Gamling finish a meal. Merry hurries off, Éomer watching him go. A guard looks down a precipice at a rider on a narrow track. Aragorn tosses in sleep, disturbed by visions of Arwen dying and wakes with his sword drawn as a guard approaches. He hurries to Théoden's tent.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
As Pippin softly concludes his poignant and bittersweet song, he lifts his gaze to look up at Denethor, who carries on without acknowledging the grave reality that he has sent his own son off to a likely death. Overwhelmed with sorrow, Pippin turns away, the weight of his emotions clearly etched on his youthful face. Meanwhile, Gandalf sits quietly and alone in a courtyard, bearing the look of defeat. Massive siege towers and catapults advance relentlessly along the reconstructed bridge that connects both sides of the city of Osgiliath, moving with menacing purpose directly towards the stronghold of Minas Tirith. 

Aragorn, alongside Théoden, Éomer, Merry, Legolas, and Gimli, gallops with determination into a sprawling encampment nestled beneath the protective cover of towering trees, where the grounds are vibrant with activity, teeming with men, horses, and numerous tents. As Théoden passes by groups of gathered soldiers, he acknowledges Grimbold, a respected Marshal of Rohan, with a grim smile and continues pressing onward. Aragorn rides up to join Théoden on a lofty bluff that overlooks the vast encampment below. The scene expands to reveal thousands of men and their horses, while smoke from countless small campfires billows up to fill the valley. Aragorn turns towards Théoden, who, with a resolute nod, comes to terms with the inescapable reality that regardless of their numbers, he must commit to the impending war by the break of morning. In the distance, horses whinny loudly, their calls echoing as Théoden glances up at the towering mountain looming ominously behind them. Horses rear up in terror as the soldiers of Rohan diligently strive to quiet them. Legolas and Gimli move steadily through the bustling camp. Legolas observes a group of Rohan soldiers sitting silently, hunched over and enveloped in a quietude that speaks volumes, then turns his attention toward Éomer, who is busy unsaddling his horse. Gimli's eyes wander to a series of ancient standing stones marking the entrance to a path that leads away from the encampment and disappears into the mountain.

Aragorn stands before this mysterious road as if in a trance. Before him, a horse, restless and skittish, whinnies and pulls nervously at its ropes, and a ghostly figure seems to materialize from the shadows. Startled, Aragorn jerks back in fright, his eyes falling upon the small dwarf. He then casts another look back at the formidable ancient standing stones before deciding to follow Gimli. The encampment falls into an eerie silence. Éowyn kneels before Merry, carefully adjusting his helmet. Merry exhales, a mix of excitement and terror evident in his expression. Overwhelmed by the moment, he draws his sword, causing Éowyn to step back, laughter bubbling up from her lips. Exiting the tent, Éowyn and Merry cross paths with Éomer and Gamling, who are seated nearby, concluding their meal. Éowyn urges Merry onward, and he scampers off with haste. Éomer watches the young hobbit make his departure as Gamling struggles to suppress a laugh. Éowyn spins around, casting a look of mock admonishment at both of them. At the edge of the plateau, a guard is positioned, peering down the steep precipice as a horse and rider steadily traverse the ridge. The hooded figure slowly makes their way along the narrow, winding zigzag path that ascends toward the plateau. Restlessly, Aragorn tosses in his sleep, troubled by haunting images and echoing voices. As Arwen lies on the brink of death, the Evenstar slips from her fingers. At that precise moment, Aragorn jolts awake, his reflexes sharp as he quickly grasps his sword when a guard appears standing at the doorway. Promptly, Aragorn hurries towards Théoden's tent, where Théoden looks up in alertness upon Aragorn’s entrance.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
As Pippin softly and tenderly concludes his moving and deeply bittersweet song, he gradually lifts his gaze to meet the solemn figure of Denethor. Denethor, however, continues onward, utterly disconnected from acknowledging the grave and somber reality that he has sent his own son off to a likely death. Overwhelmed with a profound sense of sorrow, Pippin turns away, his youthful face clearly etched with the weight of his heavy emotions. Meanwhile, Gandalf sits quietly and alone in a courtyard, embodying a look of resigned defeat. Massive siege towers and catapults advance relentlessly along the reconstructed bridge that now connects both sides of the city of Osgiliath. These fearsome machines move with menacing and determined purpose, heading directly towards the stronghold of Minas Tirith.

Aragorn, accompanied by Théoden, Éomer, Merry, Legolas, and Gimli, gallops with resolute determination into a sprawling encampment situated beneath the protective cover of towering, majestic trees. The grounds are vibrant and bustling with activity, teeming with men, numerous horses, and a myriad of tents. As Théoden rides past groups of gathered soldiers, he acknowledges Grimbold, a respected and valiant Marshal of Rohan, with a grim but determined smile, pressing onward with steadfast resolve. Aragorn rides up to join Théoden on a lofty bluff that offers a sweeping view of the extensive encampment spread out below. The scene expands, revealing thousands of men and their horses, while smoke from countless small campfires rises to fill the valley. Aragorn turns towards Théoden, who, with a resolute and firm nod, comes to terms with the inescapable reality that regardless of their numbers, they must commit to the impending war by the break of morning. In the distance, horses whinny loudly, their calls echoing as Théoden glances up at the towering, ominous mountain looming behind them. Horses rear up in terror as the soldiers of Rohan diligently strive to calm and quiet them. Legolas and Gimli move steadily through the bustling camp, observing the activity around them. Legolas's gaze falls on a group of Rohan soldiers sitting silently, hunched over and enveloped in a quietude that speaks volumes of their inner thoughts. He then turns his attention toward Éomer, who is busily engaged in unsaddling his horse. Gimli's eyes wander to a series of ancient standing stones, marking the entrance to a mysterious path that leads away from the encampment and disappears into the enigmatic mountain.

Aragorn stands before this mysterious road, seemingly in a trance. Before him, a horse, restless and skittish, whinnies and pulls nervously at its ropes, while a ghostly figure appears to materialize from the shadows. Startled by the sight, Aragorn jerks back in fright, his eyes falling upon the small dwarf beside him. He then casts another searching look back at the formidable ancient standing stones before deciding to follow Gimli onward. The entire encampment falls into an eerie silence. Nearby, Éowyn kneels before Merry, carefully adjusting his helmet with gentle hands. Merry exhales, his face a mixture of excitement and terror, emotions vividly evident in his expression. Overwhelmed by the moment, he draws his sword, causing Éowyn to step back slightly, laughter bubbling up from her lips. Exiting the tent, Éowyn and Merry cross paths with Éomer and Gamling, who are seated nearby, concluding their meal. Éowyn urges Merry onward, and he scampers off with haste and enthusiasm. Éomer observes the young hobbit making his departure, while Gamling struggles to suppress a laugh at the scene. Éowyn spins around, casting a look of mock admonishment at both of them, playfully chiding their behavior. At the edge of the plateau, a guard is positioned, peering intently down the steep precipice as a horse and rider steadily traverse the ridge below. The hooded figure slowly makes their way along the narrow, winding, zigzag path that ascends and approaches the plateau. Restlessly, Aragorn tosses and turns in his sleep, troubled by haunting images and echoing voices. As Arwen lies on the brink of death, the Evenstar slips from her delicate fingers. Precisely at that moment, Aragorn jolts awake, his reflexes sharp and alert as he quickly grasps his sword when a guard appears, standing quietly at the doorway. Promptly and without hesitation, Aragorn hurries towards Théoden's tent, where Théoden looks up with alertness and readiness upon Aragorn’s entrance.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Pippin concludes his bittersweet song, his voice trailing off into the silence as he lifts his gaze to meet Denethor's eyes, hoping for some sign of acknowledgment. However, Denethor remains impassive, as if unaware of sending his son towards impending doom, leaving Pippin to turn away, the weight of sorrow evident in his youthful features. Meanwhile, Gandalf sits in solitude within a courtyard, the quiet around him mirroring his sense of defeat. The scene shifts to massive siege towers and catapults steadily making their way across a repaired bridge that spans both sides of Osgiliath, their destination unmistakably Minas Tirith. In another part of the land, Aragorn, Théoden, Éomer, Merry, Legolas, and Gimli ride urgently into an expansive camp situated under the protective canopy of trees, the area alive with the movement of men, horses, and a multitude of tents. As they ride past a group of soldiers, Théoden catches sight of Grimbold, a Marshal of Rohan, giving him a nod of acknowledgment and offering a grim smile as he continues forward. Aragorn soon joins Théoden, and together they stand on a bluff, gazing over the sprawling encampment as the camera sweeps wide to capture thousands of men and horses scattered across the valley, with tendrils of smoke rising from numerous campfires. Aragorn turns to Théoden, their eyes meeting in understanding; Théoden comprehends the gravity of their situation—regardless of their numbers, they must commit to the battle by morning, and he affirms this with a decisive nod. The distant sound of horses whinnying breaks the stillness as Théoden's gaze lifts towards the imposing mountain looming overhead. Horses rear back, their fear palpable, while Rohan soldiers attempt to soothe them. Within the camp, Legolas and Gimli navigate through the maze of tents and people, with Legolas casting a glance at a nearby group of Rohan soldiers who sit silently, faces drawn, before turning his attention to Éomer, busy unsaddling his horse. Gimli's eyes drift to a line of ancient standing stones marking the entrance to a foreboding road that stretches away from the encampment and vanishes into the shadowy mountain. Aragorn stands before this road, seemingly entranced by the sight, while nearby, a skittish horse pulls against its ropes, a ghostly figure hinting at its emergence from the mist. Startled, Aragorn's gaze darts down to the diminutive dwarf at his side, then returns to the hauntingly ancient stones before he follows Gimli, leaving behind the stillness of the camp. Elsewhere, Éowyn kneels before Merry, carefully adjusting his helmet to ensure a proper fit. Merry breathes out, excitement and fear warring within him, his emotions boiling over as he unsheathes his sword, prompting Éowyn to step back, laughter bubbling forth at the spontaneous act. Together they leave the tent, encountering Éomer and Gamling seated not far away, completing their meal. Éowyn gently nudges Merry to continue on, and he scurries off, Éomer's eyes following the young hobbit's retreating form while Gamling suppresses a chuckle. Returning her attention to Éomer and Gamling, Éowyn sends them a pointed look. Elsewhere, on the plateau’s edge, a guard peers down the steep precipice, observing a lone horse and rider making their deliberate ascent up the winding, narrow path that leads to the plateau's summit. As the day turns to night, Aragorn is restless in sleep, plagued by unsettling visions and disembodied voices. In one vision, Arwen lies dying, and the Evenstar jewel slips from her grasp. Jolted awake at that pivotal moment, Aragorn instinctively reaches for his sword, alert to the presence of a guard who stands watchfully in the doorway. Driven by urgency, Aragorn makes his way swiftly to Théoden's tent, where Théoden looks up expectantly as Aragorn enters, ready for whatever news or action awaits.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Pippin finishes his bittersweet song and looks up at Denethor, who remains indifferent to his son's fate. Pippin, sorrowful, turns away. Elsewhere, Gandalf sits alone, appearing defeated. Meanwhile, siege towers and catapults advance towards Minas Tirith over the repaired bridge at Osgiliath. Aragorn, Théoden, Éomer, Merry, Legolas, and Gimli arrive at a large encampment beneath trees, bustling with men, horses, and tents. Théoden acknowledges Grimbold, a Marshal of Rohan, while grimly riding onward. Aragorn and Théoden survey the vast camp from a bluff, realizing the inevitable commitment to war by morning as Théoden nods in agreement. Horses react nervously near the mountain, while Rohan soldiers try to calm them. Legolas observes anxious Rohan soldiers and Éomer unsaddling his horse, while Gimli notes ancient standing stones marking a road into the mountain. Aragorn, entranced by the stones, is startled by a ghostly figure before following Gimli. The camp falls silent as Éowyn adjusts Merry's helmet, causing him both excitement and fear. Merry draws his sword in excitement, making Éowyn laugh. As they exit the tent, Éomer and Gamling finish their meal nearby, and Éowyn guides Merry away. Éomer observes, amused, as Éowyn scolds him and Gamling. A guard at the plateau edge watches a hooded rider ascend a narrow track. Aragorn, disturbed by visions of Arwen and the Evenstar, awakens abruptly with his sword in hand as a guard waits at the door. He hurries to Théoden's tent, where Théoden acknowledges his arrival.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Pippin finishes his bittersweet song, a melody reflecting the ancient traditions of the Shire, and looks up at Denethor, the Steward of Gondor, who continues as if he has not sent his son, Faramir, to his death in a desperate sortie. Pippin turns away, his sorrow etched on his young face, reminiscent of the deep bond between him and Faramir during their time in Minas Tirith. Gandalf, the wise wizard known for his pivotal role in resisting the forces of Sauron, sits quietly in a courtyard, alone and defeated, contemplating the looming battle. Great siege towers and catapults, reminiscent of the fearsome engines used in historical sieges, roll along the repaired bridge that spans both sides of Osgiliath, the ruined city once a key outpost of Gondor, heading straight towards Minas Tirith, the last bastion against the darkness. Aragorn, Théoden, Éomer, Merry, Legolas, and Gimli gallop into a vast camp beneath the cover of trees, teeming with men, horses, and tents, each preparing for the war to come. Théoden, the deeply respected King of Rohan, acknowledges Grimbold, a Marshal of Rohan known for his courage in battle, as he passes by a group of soldiers and smiles grimly as he rides on, aware of the daunting task ahead. Aragorn joins Théoden on a bluff overlooking the encampment. The camera cranes to reveal thousands of men and horses from the realm of Rohan, with smoke from many small campfires filling the valley. Aragorn turns to Théoden, who realizes that no matter the numbers, he must commit to war by the morning and nods. The horses, bred for their endurance and intelligence, whinny loudly in the distance as Théoden looks up at the mountain looming behind them, part of the White Mountains known in lore for their ominous presence. Horses rear in terror as Rohan soldiers try to quiet them, sensing the tension in the air. Legolas, the elven prince skilled in archery, and Gimli, the stalwart dwarf with unmatched ax-wielding prowess, move through the camp. Legolas looks at a group of Rohan soldiers who sit quiet and hunched, with no one speaking, and then looks toward Éomer, Théoden’s loyal nephew, who is unsaddling his horse. Gimli's eyes travel to a row of ancient standing stones, remnants of an older civilization, marking the entrance to a road leading away from the encampment and into the mountain, said to be haunted by the spirits of men bound by an ancient oath. Aragorn stands before the road as though transfixed, understanding the gravity of the path before him; before him, a horse whinnies and pulls at his ropes nervously, and a ghostly figure, perhaps a reminder of the prophecy, seems to emerge from the gloom. Aragorn starts in fright as he stares down at the little dwarf, then casts another look back at the ancient standing stones before following Gimli. All is quiet in the encampment. Éowyn, the brave shieldmaiden of Rohan, kneels before Merry, adjusting his helmet, sharing a brief moment of camaraderie. Merry exhales, excited and terrified in equal measure, feeling the weight of his decision to fight alongside the men. In his excitement, he draws his sword, and Éowyn steps back, laughing at the hobbit’s enthusiasm. As Éowyn and Merry leave the tent, Éomer and Gamling, another trusted soldier, sit nearby, finishing a meal. Éowyn ushers Merry off, and Merry hurries away, determined to prove himself. Éomer watches the young hobbit leave as Gamling stifles a laugh, aware of the hobbit’s courage. Éowyn turns on both of them, displaying her fierce spirit. At the plateau edge, a guard looks down the steep precipice as a horse and rider, perhaps a messenger from a distant land, move along the ridge. The hooded figure slowly rides up the narrow zigzag track leading up to the plateau, a path known for its strategic importance. Aragorn tosses in his sleep, disturbed by images and voices foretelling the battles to come. As Arwen, his beloved and the daughter of Elrond, lies dying, the Evenstar, a symbol of her immortality, falls from her fingers. At that moment, Aragorn wakes, his sword quickly in his hand, ready to face any threat, as a guard stands in the doorway. Aragorn hurries towards Théoden's tent, and Théoden looks up as Aragorn, the rightful heir to the throne of Gondor, enters.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: Pippin finishes his bittersweet song and looks up at Denethor who continues as if he has not sent his son to his death. Pippin turns away his sorrow etched on his young face. Gandalf sits quietly in a courtyard alone and defeated. Great siege towers and catapults roll along the repaired bridge that spans both sides of Osgiliath heading straight towards Minas Tirith. Aragorn Théoden Éomer Merry. Legolas and Gimli gallop into a vast camp beneath the cover of trees teeming with men horses and tents. Théoden acknowledges Grimbold a Marshal of Rohan as he passes by a group of soldiers and smiles grimly as he rides on. Aragorn joins Théoden on a bluff overlooking the encampment. The camera cranes to reveal thousands of men and horses with smoke from many small campfires filling the valley. Aragorn turns to Théoden who realizes that no matter the numbers he must commit to war by the morning and nods. The horses whinny loudly in the distance as Théoden looks up at the mountain looming behind them. Horses rear in terror as Rohan soldiers try to quiet them. Legolas and Gimli move through the camp. Legolas looks at a group of Rohan soldiers who sit quiet and hunched with no one speaking and then looks toward Éomer who is unsaddling his horse. Gimli's eyes travel to a row of ancient standing stones marking the entrance to a road leading away from the encampment and into the mountain. Aragorn stands before the road as though transfixed before him. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. a horse whinnies and pulls at his ropes nervously and a ghostly figure seems to emerge from the gloom. Aragorn starts in fright as he stares down at the little dwarf then casts another look back at the ancient standing stones before following Gimli. All is quiet in the encampment. Éowyn kneels before Merry adjusting his helmet. Merry exhales excited and terrified in equal measure. In his excitement he draws his sword and Éowyn steps back laughing. As Éowyn and Merry leave the tent Éomer and Gamling sit nearby finishing a meal. Éowyn ushers Merry off and Merry hurries away. Éomer watches the young hobbit leave as Gamling stifles a laugh. Éowyn turns on both of them. At the plateau edge a guard looks down the steep precipice as a horse and rider move along the ridge. The hooded figure slowly rides up the narrow zigzag track leading up to the plateau. Aragorn tosses in his sleep disturbed by images and voices. As Arwen lies dying the Evenstar falls from her fingers. At that moment Aragorn wakes his sword quickly in his hand as a guard stands in the doorway. Aragorn hurries towards Théoden's tent and Théoden looks up as Aragorn enters.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: Pippin finishes his bittersweet song and looks up at Denethor who continues as if he has not sent his son to his death. Pippin turns away his sorrow etched on his young face. Gandalf sits quietly in a courtyard alone and defeated. Great siege towers and catapults roll along the repaired bridge that spans both sides of Osgiliath heading straight towards Minas Tirith. Aragorn Théoden Éomer Merry. Legolas and Gimli gallop into a vast camp beneath the cover of trees teeming with men horses and tents. Théoden acknowledges Grimbold a Marshal of Rohan as he passes by a group of soldiers and smiles grimly as he rides on. Aragorn joins Théoden on a bluff overlooking the encampment. The camera cranes to reveal thousands of men and horses with smoke from many small campfires filling the valley. Aragorn turns to Théoden who realizes that no matter the numbers he must commit to war by the morning and nods. The horses whinny loudly in the distance as Théoden looks up at the mountain looming behind them. Horses rear in terror as Rohan soldiers try to quiet them. Legolas and Gimli move through the camp. Legolas looks at a group of Rohan soldiers who sit quiet and hunched with no one speaking and then looks toward Éomer who is unsaddling his horse. Gimli's eyes travel to a row of ancient standing stones marking the entrance to a road leading away from the encampment and into the mountain. Aragorn stands before the road as though transfixed before him. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. a horse whinnies and pulls at his ropes nervously and a ghostly figure seems to emerge from the gloom. Éowyn kneels before Merry adjusting his helmet. Merry exhales excited and terrified in equal measure. In his excitement he draws his sword and Éowyn steps back laughing. As Éowyn and Merry leave the tent Éomer and Gamling sit nearby finishing a meal. Éowyn ushers Merry off and Merry hurries away. Éomer watches the young hobbit leave as Gamling stifles a laugh. Éowyn turns on both of them. At the plateau edge a guard looks down the steep precipice as a horse and rider move along the ridge. The hooded figure slowly rides up the narrow zigzag track leading up to the plateau. Aragorn tosses in his sleep disturbed by images and voices. As Arwen lies dying the Evenstar falls from her fingers. At that moment Aragorn wakes his sword quickly in his hand as a guard stands in the doorway. Aragorn hurries towards Théoden's tent and Théoden looks up as Aragorn enters.

Gandalf sits quietly in a courtyard alone and defeated. Great siege towers and catapults roll along the repaired bridge that spans both sides of Osgiliath heading straight towards Minas Tirith. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Whiskers concludes his tangy melody and glances over at Barnacle, who proceeds as if he has not dispatched his brother to his demise. Whiskers turns away, his gloom etched on his small brow. Truffles perches quietly in a meadow, solitary and vanquished. Enormous fortresses and trebuchets rumble along the renovated pathway that links both ends of Harpshire, heading directly towards Citrus Grove. Snickers, Marmaduke, Fiddlesticks, Pickles, Tinkerbell, and Cookie dash into a gigantic circus underneath the shade of canopies, bustling with cats, parrots, and carts. Marmaduke acknowledges Bluster, a Keeper of Whiskerville, as he strolls past a cluster of knights and chuckles soberly as he marches on. Snickers joins Marmaduke on a ledge overlooking the carnival. The drone soars to unveil throngs of cats and parrots with steam from numerous tiny bonfires filling the valley. Snickers turns to Marmaduke, who understands that regardless of the throng, he must pledge to adventure by the evening and nods. The parrots squawk loudly in the background as Marmaduke gazes up at the hill towering above them. Parrots prance in alarm as Whiskerville knights attempt to soothe them. Tinkerbell and Cookie wander through the circus. Tinkerbell observes a group of Whiskerville knights who sit silent and slouched, with nobody speaking, and then glances toward Fiddlesticks, who is unsaddling his parrot. Cookie's eyes drift to a line of ancient marking totems denoting the entrance to a trail leading away from the carnival and into the hill. Snickers stands in front of the trail as though enchanted, before him a parrot squawks and tugs at her vines restlessly, and a misty shape seems to arise from the fog. Snickers jumps in shock as he gawks down at the tiny elf, then casts another glance back at the ancient marking totems before trailing Cookie. All is still in the carnival. Daisy kneels before Pickles, tweaking his scarf. Pickles breathes out, thrilled and horrified in equal measure. In his thrill, he unsheathes his lance, and Daisy steps back, giggling. As Daisy and Pickles depart the cart, Fiddlesticks and Giggles lounge nearby, completing a snack. Daisy nudges Pickles forward, and Pickles scurries away. Fiddlesticks observes the young sprite depart as Giggles muffles a snicker. Daisy spins on both of them. At the bluff margin, a watchman peers down the steep drop-off as a parrot and traveler saunter along the crest. The cloaked silhouette steadily trots up the slender zigzag path leading up to the bluff. Snickers tosses in his slumber, perturbed by visions and hums. As Jasmine lies fading, the Moonflower slips from her feathers. At that juncture, Snickers awakens, his lance swiftly in his paw as a watchman stands in the portal. Snickers dashes towards Marmaduke's cart, and Marmaduke glances up as Snickers arrives.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Pippin finishes his song and looks at Denethor, who acts indifferent to sending his son to death. Pippin’s sorrow is evident as Gandalf sits alone, defeated. Siege towers approach Minas Tirith. Aragorn, Théoden, Éomer, Merry, Legolas, and Gimli arrive at a large camp. Théoden acknowledges Rohan’s Marshal Grimbold and solemnly understands the unavoidable war commitment. As horses react fearfully, Legolas and Gimli observe the tense camp and ancient stones marking a path into the mountain. Aragorn is drawn to them and then follows Gimli. In the camp, Éowyn helps Merry prepare for battle, balancing excitement with fear. Éomer and Gamling share a moment as Éowyn leads Merry away. Meanwhile, a hooded figure ascends a track to the plateau. Aragorn, troubled by visions of a dying Arwen, awakens suddenly and rushes to Théoden's tent.
